title: God Our Refuge
shortSummary: Psalm 46 declares God as the unshakable refuge and strength for His people amid chaos and calamity. It encourages believers to trust in God's sovereign power and presence, offering peace and confidence even when the world seems to be falling apart.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to the sons of Korah

keyCharacters.name: Sons of Korah
keyCharacters.description: A Levitical family of temple singers and composers credited with this psalm, emphasizing worship and trust in God.

keyCharacters.name: God (The LORD of hosts, God of Jacob)
keyCharacters.description: Portrayed as the powerful protector and refuge of His people, actively intervening in times of trouble.

definitions.definition: A musical term or style indicating a high-pitched or female vocal part, used in the psalm's musical direction.
A liturgical or musical pause in the psalm, inviting reflection on the preceding words.
A place of safety and protection; metaphorically, God is the protector and shelter for believers.
A title for God emphasizing His command over heavenly armies and supreme power.

outline.heading: God Our Refuge and Strength
outline.description: The psalm opens by affirming God as a present help in trouble, providing courage even when natural disasters threaten the earth.

outline.heading: The River That Gladdens the City of God
outline.description: Describes the sustaining presence of God in His holy city, ensuring its stability and early help in times of need.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereign Power Over Nations
outline.description: Depicts God's control over raging nations and wars, demonstrating His ability to bring peace and end conflict.

outline.heading: Call to Be Still and Recognize God’s Sovereignty
outline.description: Concludes with an exhortation to cease striving and acknowledge God's exaltation and presence as the ultimate refuge.

application: Trust God as your refuge in times of personal or communal crisis, knowing He is always present to help.
Practice stillness and prayer to recognize God's sovereignty rather than succumbing to fear or anxiety.
Rely on God's power to bring peace in situations of conflict, both in the world and in your own life.
Remember that God’s presence stabilizes and sustains His people, encouraging faithfulness and hope.

keyVerses.text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
keyVerses.significance: This foundational verse establishes God as the dependable protector and source of strength for believers.

keyVerses.text: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful call to cease striving and acknowledge God's supreme authority and glory.

keyVerses.text: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: Reaffirms God's protective presence with His people, encouraging confidence and trust.
